awards.title: Sitecore Experience Awards '16
awards.description:
Macaw has been rewarded whith a Sitecore® Experience Award in the category "Ultimate Experience Benelux and France".  Every year Sitecore, wordleader in customer experience management, hands out the Sitecore® Experience Awards. This award is given to their partners and customers who show their sitecore solutions create a great experience for themselfes and their visitors.

As winner of the Ultimate Experience Award Macaw and Heineken prove they can deliver the right content to the right visitor. The international website of Heineken handles content managent, omnichannel marketing and personalisation in an optimal way. Macaw shows intelligent use of marketing automation and personalisation and is capable to prove the improvements by the use of statisics before and after the implementation of Sitecore.

projects.title: VWPFS Experienceplatform
projects.description:
For this customer we "upgraded" the old 8.2 sitecore platform. From scratch we build a new Sitecore 9.0 (and later upgraded to  9.1) SXA platform currently hosting 55 websites build on the Framework which was designed during our other projects.

During this project (or actually a longterm devops team) we've build several solutions for our customer all based to collect leads. 

 - A connection to an external API that fetches the cars and private lease prices where customers can select a car and request a price indication (www.autoabonnement.nl/aanbod). 
 - Another connection to a HR system containing vacancies (jobs.vwpfs.nl) 
 - And one of the last features is an external party that pushes occasions into our platform which we have to process and show on our website. The biggest challenge here was the performance. Using a Queue, Azure Functions, Azure storage and a CDN we managed to build a high performance processing mechanism, offloaded from the Sitecore platform so that we have an optimal use of the resources (https://www.xllease.nl/zakelijke-lease/financial-lease/aanbod).

projects.title: ONVZ
projects.description:
During this period, I was added to one of the 3 scrum teams that worked on the Sitecore platform for our customer Onvz. Initially I was requested to setup a new label using SXA (www.jaaah.nl). During this setup we had a close connection with the content editors and the product owner and added our knowledge to build a easy to use website just in time for the new insurance season in November. During that time ONVZ also went live with an upgraded version of Sitecore (9.3) with a few complications where I could help my knowledge and experience of Sitecore running on Azure. 

Because there was a good match, my time at ONVZ was extended and currently I'm still there helping them out keeping the platform up and running until the Sitecore platform is being replaced.

projects.title: HCS Services

My role was to migrate the existing website (managed by a 3rth party) to this new fundament. With the use of Bicep templates I setup a infrastructure deploy with CI/CD pipelines fulfilling the needs of the supplier of the website, but compatible with all the policies and conventions.

projects.title: SmurfitKappa.com
projects.description:
Building a multisite/lingual Sitecore platform for SmurfitKappa running on Azure Infra and using Azure Search as a search provider.. During this project I was the teamlead and together with the team we build a new framework (v3) for Sitecore projects. I this new framework we implemented and improved all the learnings from the framework that we build in our earlier projects. We applied a read good separation between frontend and backend with a common datamodel so both ends were not dependent on each other while building.  This foundation is still being used in almost all of our Sitecore projects. 

Used technology: Sitecore, Azure webapps, Azure search, devops, CI/CD, ReactJs and more.

projects.title: HEMA V5.0
projects.description:
This project is targeted at upgrading the deployment method. Currently deploying a new version costs about 2-3 days (if everything goes well). The reason this takes that long is because the application runs in the context of SharePoint so every deployment requires a SharePoint deploy as well. 

The main task in this project will be detaching the application from the SharePoint context and just use the web services (lists.asmx) for fetching content. With this change, a new version will not require a SharePoint deployment and the application can be deployed just using relatively simple copy scripting.

Next to detaching from SharePoint, the SharePoint infrastructure will also be renewed so it will be easier for content-editors to manage the content and next to that less SharePoint installations will be required.

projects.title: ReleaseManagement Tool
projects.description:
Using Octopus Deploy we implemented a release management tool for HEMA. With this new tool we can deploy a new version with a single click of a button. The previous release method contained a 50 step manual with lots of potential (human) errors.

With this new deploy method i also implemented a custom Build definition in TFS 2015 in a way that a new build pushes new packages to Octopus Deploy and initiates a new deploy on the first node of the OTAP. After aproval the package can move to Test, Acceptation and finally Production.

projects.title: HEMA Internationalization
projects.description:
This project involved the internationalization of the Hema Webshop meaning that the application needed to be changed so it could provide a base to host the Webshop for several countries. Up until now each country specific site was hosted in its own application.

The project was divided in 3 phases:

Phase 1:
During this phase we created the base for the multinational site and facilitated the site for Germany

Phase 2:
Here we added the sites for the United Kingdom and Spain and provided more a flexible application being able to hold multiple countries.

Phase 3:
This phase was meant for the implementation of all international mobile websites (Belgium, France, Germany, United Kingdom and Spain).

projects.title: Ricoh Apollo project - online training and support system
projects.description:
The Ricoh Apollo project at Bluedesk involves the design and implementation of an extensive system for combined online training and e-learning, product information for field personnel and support engineers and online end user support for Ricoh printing solutions.
As analyst, I gathered and documented requirements and as functional designer I created detailed functional designs for a majority of the application. 
As functional designer combined with a temporary role as interim test coordinator I adjusted the test processes and designed the global test plan and detailed functional design documents. These documents now double as a work-ready description for development as well as a checklist for system testing. 
Using Function Point Analysis (FPA), I was responsible for checking and fixing deviations between budget based on customer’s requirements and projected cost of implementation based on the detail functional designs. This pro-actively helped contain budget overruns.
